member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Extensions.FormulaCompilerExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for IFormulaCompiler.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Extensions.FormulaCompilerExtensions.GetResult(AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler,System.String,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry)
member.summary: Compiles a formula and returns the invoked result.
member.param: The IFormulaCompiler instance used to compile the formula.
The formula as a string.
An optional registry where, if required, contains previously populated variables required for the evaluation of the formula.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler
member.summary: Compiles a mathematical expression provided as a string to a delegate that can be repeatedly invoked for re-evaluation.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler.#ctor(AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The arithmetic operation factory used for building expressions.
The user-defined method factory used for evaluating higher level operations.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler.Compile(System.String,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry)
member.summary: Compiles a formula represented as a string into a delegate that can be repeatedly invoked for re-evaluation.
member.param: The mathematical formula to be compiled.

The registry of variables referenced by the formula that are required for evaluation. This can be populated with all required variables before or after compilation, but before evaluation. If a registry is not provided then an instance will be created. In both cases, the registry will be included with the compiler result.
member.returns: The compiler result containing the variable registry, the compiled delegate, and a list of variables referenced by the formula (if applicable).

member.summary: An operation used to calculate the angle (in radians) of a cosine value.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperation
member.summary: Represents an arithmetic operator or a user-defined method.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperation.Precedence
member.summary: The precedence that determines the order of operations. A lower precedence value indicates a higher priority (refer to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_operations).

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperation.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[],AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operators.IOperator})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The precedence that determines the order of operations.
The number of required arguments for the operator or user-defined method.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperationBase
member.summary: An abstract base class for all arithmetic operators and user defined methods.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperationBase.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[],AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operators.IOperator})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The number of required arguments.
The factory that creates the required operation using the provided arguments (as expressions).

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperationFactory
member.summary: A factory used for registering and creating instances of an ArithmeticOperation that implements an associated operator. The factory assumes a lower precedence value indicates a higher priority (refer to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_operations).

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperationFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperationFactory.RegisterOperation(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[],AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operators.IOperator})
member.remarks: If the symbol is already registered then an OperationFactoryException will be raised.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.ArithmeticOperationFactory.GetOperation(System.String)
member.returns: Only one instance per type is ever created.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperation
member.summary: Represents an arithmetic operator or user defined method.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperation.ArgumentCount
member.summary: The number of arguments required by the operator or user defined method.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperation.GetExpression(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[])
member.summary: Creates an Expression that represents the operator or user defined method.
member.param: The arguments required for creating the required expression.
member.returns: The expression representing the operator or user defined method.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory
member.summary: Represents an arithmetic operation factory for registering and creating instances of an ArithmeticOperation that implements an associated operator..
member.remarks: It is recommended to use a single instance of the factory.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory.RegisteredOperations
member.summary: Gets all registered operations based on their associated symbol.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory.TryRegisterOperation(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[],AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operators.IOperator})
member.summary: Attempts to register a new operation in terms of its operator symbol, precedence level and a factory used for creating the required operation. If the symbol is already registered then the request is ignored.
member.param: The symbol that identifies the operation being registered.
The precedence level that determines the order of operations. A lower value indicates a higher precedence.
The number of required arguments.
The factory used to create the operation using the provided arguments (as expressions).
member.returns: True if the symbol was registered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory.RegisterOperation(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[],AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operators.IOperator})
member.summary: Registers a new operation in terms of its operator symbol, precedence level and a factory used for creating the required operation.
member.param: The symbol that identifies the operation being registered.
The precedence level that determines the order of operations. A lower value indicates a higher precedence.
The number of required arguments.
The factory used to create the operation using the provided arguments (as expressions).

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory.GetOperation(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the operation object associated with a specified operator symbol.
member.param: The symbol that identifies the operation to be created.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory
member.summary: Represents a user defined method factory.
member.remarks: It is recommended to use a single instance of the factory.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory.RegisteredMethods
member.summary: Gets all registered user-defined method names.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory.RegisterMethod``1(System.String)
member.summary: Registers a user defined method with the factory using an associated name and operation type.
member.typeparam: The operation type (inheriting ArithmeticOperationBase) that implements the user-defined method.
member.param: The name of the user-defined method.
member.remarks: The operation type must not maintain state (and therefore be thread safe) as the factory will only ever create a single instance.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory.IsRegistered(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates if the provided user-defined method name is registered with the factory.
member.param: The name of the user-defined method to check.
member.returns: True if the user-defined method name is registered.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory.GetMethod(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an instance of the class implementing the user-defined method identified by the provided method name.
member.param: The name of the user-defined method identifying the operation type to return.
member.returns: The concrete type implementing the user-defined method.
